revised_title: Results from the Large Electron Positron Collider at CERN - The DELPHI Experiment
tldr: The DELPHI experiment at CERN's Large Electron Positron Collider aimed to study the final state particles produced in electron-positron collisions. The detector focused on three-dimensional information, high granularity, precise vertex determination, and particle identification. During its first year of operation, DELPHI recorded 138,000 hadronic decays, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 6.3. The experiment provided valuable insights into particle physics and high energy physics.
